article_title: Texas gay marriage ban ruled unconstitutional; Florida executes trooper's killer; Syrian forces clash with rebels: A.M. National and World News Links
article_text:
Top stories

Federal judge rules Texas' gay marriage ban is unconstitutional (Dallas Morning News)

Florida executes man for killing state trooper with pipe bomb in 1992 (Gainesville Sun)

Syrian forces claim to kill many rebels in Eastern Ghouta (BBC)

National news

Service members testify to Senate panel on sexual violence (Los Angeles Times)

U.S. wants to extend time it can hold surveillance data (CNN)

Hillary Clinton defends Affordable Care Act (Politico)

Arizona residents begin monitoring immigration checkpoint (Los Angeles Times)

BP loses bid to block seafood fund payments (Reuters)

Supersonic jet throws traditional design 'out the window' (NPR)

Florida city caps sewer of woman living 'off the grid' (News-Press.com)

Study says babies can't learn to read (The Atlantic)

World news

Mexico president sees no swift extradition of kingpin Guzman (Reuters)

Kashmir: Indian soldier shoots five colleagues dead (BBC)

Obama set to take a more active role in Mideast peacemaking (New York Times)

Indian submarine accident leaves 2 sailors missing and navy chief out of job (CNN)

Thai prime minister faces graft charges as standoff slips out of control (Times of India)

U.S. envoy tells China, Japan to lower temperature in sea row (Reuters)

U.S.-South Korea relations stregthened by North's actions, report says (Stars and Stripes)

Civilians flee as violence worsens in South Sudan (New York Times)

The Syria conflict in photos (ABC News)
